Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with rosette in added white and added red above added red band lined in white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of spotted animal (part of body with white spots remaining); part of rosette as filling ornament; below in offset handle zone, two brown lines above guilloche.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places the sherd within the Chalice Style, but the exterior decoration and rosette are not consistent with that style. G. Schaus and J. L. Benson suggest the figure is a cock as some cocks are depicted as spotted, but the one they cite (Walter-Karydi pl. 92, no. 718 from Thasos) has black spots. Some boars are depicted with coloured spots, see British Museum 1888,0601.466.d, 1888,0601.466.e and 1888,0601.466.f and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA74.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 303, no. 1122, pl. 154)
CVA Philadelphia II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Fasc. 29, The University Museum Philadelphia II (p. 15, pl. 5, no. 1b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0613) (phase 2)
